newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunker fall on weak crude, high stocks.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunker fall on weak crude, high stocks.

text.p: Singapore bunker quotes plunged in line with overnight crude prices, high stocks and thin demand, traders said on Monday.

Bunker 380-cst broke the $100 per tonne levels to be quoted by majors at $99 and independents at $97. Majors said they are unwilling to lower market levels as cargo prices were still firmed. Bunker 180-cst was at $108-$109 per tonne.

"It's a buyers' market currently," said one major. "We may stay out of the market until prices made some recovery," said a seller. MDO and gas oil were priced at $190-$205 and $210-$220 per tonne respectively. -- Singapore Newsroom (+65-870 3082)
